bdi4jade.goal

Class CompositeGoal

  • java.lang.Object
    • bdi4jade.goal.CompositeGoal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Goal, jade.content.Concept, jade.content.ContentElement, jade.content.Term, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParallelGoal, SequentialGoal

    public abstract class CompositeGoal
extends java.lang.Object
implements Goal
    This class represents a goal that is a composition of other goals (subgoals). It has two main subclasses, which indicate if the goals must be achieved in a parallel or sequential way.
    Author:
    Ingrid Nunes
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • CompositeGoal

        public CompositeGoal(Goal[] goals)
        Instantiates a CompositeGoal with the provided goals array. A Collection is instantiated by the method createGoals(int) and is initialized with the provided goals.
        Parameters:
        goals - the goals that compose this goal.

        Returns:
        the collection.

      • getCompletedGoals

        public java.util.List<Goal> getCompletedGoals()
        Returns the goals of this composite goal that successfully finished.
        Returns:
        the completedGoals the goals that were achieved.

      • getFailedGoal

        public GoalEvent getFailedGoal()
        Returns the goal event associated with a goal that could not be achieved, if any. If it is not possible to achieve one of the goals, the remaining goals that were not completed yet will not be achieved. If there are goals part of this composite goal that are being tried to be achieved, they become no longer desired.
        Returns:
        the goal that failed.

      • getGoals

        public java.util.Collection<Goal> getGoals()
        Returns the goals associated with this composite goal.
        Returns:
        the goals.

      • setCompletedGoals

        public void setCompletedGoals(java.util.List<Goal> completedGoals)
        Sets the list of completed goals.
        Parameters:
        completedGoals - the completedGoals to set.

      • setFailedGoal

        public void setFailedGoal(GoalEvent failedGoal)
        Sets the goal event associated with the goal that failed.
        Parameters:
        failedGoal - the failedGoal to set.
